name: PlaygroundPage
desc: An object you use to configure the state of a playground page and its live view.

items.name: func setLiveView<IncomingView>(IncomingView)
items.desc: Displays a SwiftUI view that shows the result of running the code that’s on the current page.

items.name: func setLiveView<IncomingView>(IncomingView)
items.desc: Displays a view that shows the result of running the code that’s on the current page.

items.name: var liveView: PlaygroundLiveViewable?
items.desc: A live view that shows the result of running the code that’s on the current page.

items.name: var executionMode: PlaygroundPage.ExecutionMode
items.desc: The currently selected speed for executing the code on this playground page.

items.name: enum PlaygroundPage.ExecutionMode
items.desc: The available speeds for executing the code on a playground page.

items.name: var needsIndefiniteExecution: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether indefinite execution is enabled.

items.name: func finishExecution() -> Never
items.desc: Terminates execution of the current playground page.

items.name: var assessmentStatus: PlaygroundPage.AssessmentStatus?
items.desc: A value that indicates whether a learner has passed, failed, or not yet finished the task on a page.

items.name: enum PlaygroundPage.AssessmentStatus
items.desc: The values you use to communicate whether a learner has passed, failed, or not yet finished the task on a page.

items.name: var text: String
items.desc: The current contents of the playground page, including any user-entered text.

items.name: var liveTouchBar: NSTouchBar?
items.desc: An object you use to add items to the Touch Bar of supported MacBook Pro models.

items.name: func showGlossaryEntry(named: String, at: CGRect?, in: UIView?)
